definition: lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
(negative prefix)/not/no
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station

sentences.english: There are a few small down sides, but in general it works as advertised.
sentences.chinese: 当然也有一些小毛病，但总体来说的确是名不虚传。

sentences.english: The food here deserves its name.
sentences.chinese: 这里的饭菜果然名不虚传。

sentences.english: He is poet worthy of the name.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个名不虚传的诗人。

sentences.english: It was the remaining half of the justly celebrated English cavalry.
sentences.chinese: 那是那些名不虚传的英国骑兵的一半。

sentences.english: They are the Chinese worthy of the name .
sentences.chinese: 他们是名不虚传的中国人。

sentences.english: This, coupled with brisk action drama, and large movements of the head of a well-deserved reputation.
sentences.chinese: 爽快的动作再配合剧情，动作大片的名头名不虚传。

definition: to be worthy of/to deserve to be called/to prove oneself to be
to have an undeserved reputation (idiom)
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
knowing sb by their reputation can't compare to meeting them in person (idiom)
pinyin: wen2 ming2 bu4 ru2 jian4 mian4

definition: really/as expected/sure enough/if indeed.../if it's really...
seeing once is better than hearing a hundred times (idiom); seeing for oneself is better than hearing from many others/seeing is believing
pinyin: bai3 wen2 bu4 ru2 yi1 jian4

definition: first under heaven/number one in the country
out of the ordinary
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)
really/sure enough/as expected/if indeed
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)
ashamed
old variant of 愧[kui4]
to be full of praise (idiom)
to have real skill/to know one's stuff
